*tap*tap*tap* is this thing on? "lsmod | grep floppy"?
hmm, no response at all? try "sudo modprobe floppy", and see if it doesn't load the driver for you.
might just be that it wasn't loaded automatically when the drivers were swapped.
interesting. so what device does it mount as? try a "mount" when the windows floppy is inserted.
there should be one line corresponding to the floppy; something like "/dev/sda1 on /mnt/floppy" or the like.
if it's easier, you can just pastebin the output of "mount"
ah, so try superfomat with the /dev/sdb argument.
/dev/sda is the disk in the machine, surely?
how did you unmount the drive?
can you verify that /dev/sdb is not mounted via "df"? also, what was the exact superformat command you used?

hmm. unfortunately, i have to be afk for a while. my only suggestion at this point would be to burn the floppy drive :-) you can make a normal filesystem on it using mke2fs, which is probably your best bet. superformat is for low-level formatting anyway, not really needed for a "recent" floppy disk.
or just leave the windows filesystem in place, might be easier when interacting with other systems. good luck!
